Server.name: Server
Server.description:
The core Server module in superfluous contains code related to routing,
 authentication, page generation, template rendering and input handling.

Client.name: Client
Client.description:
The core Client module contains code related to page delivery, asset
management, socket setup and controller management.

db (server).name: db (server)
db (server).description:
The DB is a simple API for grabbing collections from Mongo. It makes sure
 that the DB connection is created before accessing the collection. In
 general, this should not fail, but it might.

bootloader (client).name: bootloader (client)
bootloader (client).description:
The bootloader is responsible for managing the assets on the page. It
exposes an API to load javascript, styles and components asynchronously and run
a callback when they are loaded.

component (client).name: component (client)
component (client).description:
This class is responsible for creating, instantiating and rendering
 components on the client.

controller (client).name: controller (client)
controller (client).description:
This module is responsible for instantiating controllers on the client side
and calling into the controller on directions from the bridge.

auth (server).name: auth (server)
auth (server).description:
The auth class helps with setting up the SSL server and connecting the
authentication between the sockets and request.

bridge (server).name: bridge (server)
bridge (server).description:
The Bridge is responsible for communication between the client and server
during app delivery. The bridge flushes payloads and instructions to the
client delivery engine, which downloads the payload dependencies before
inserting the payload into the page.

The bridge can be used by the Server Controller to load dependencies or make
explicit calls into client side JS modules.

component (server).name: component (server)
component (server).description:
A Component is a Backbone View and the templates, styles and javascript that
it is packaged with.

This module exposes an API for creating components on the server. Any
Componet will be an instance of a Backbone.View and have several convenience
methods attached, including toString and marshall.

(See components/component.js for the conveniences)

config (server).name: config (server)
config (server).description:
This module loads the configuration for the superfluous app. 

It first loads config/config.js for a base set of configuration options.
It then loads config/override.js for any local overrides (this file should be placed .gitignore)
It then loads config/${ENV}.js (this should be something like 'localhost', 'production', etc

When requiring this module, the cascading objects will be available as
properties on it.

context (server).name: context (server)
context (server).description:
The Context module is how the server carries around request specific
 information.
During the request execution and app render, the superfluous core code will
 use this context to coordinate information between modules. This is a sort
 of "Request Local Storage", that is available in PHP or other thread based
 web handlers. As a convenicence, it allows any variable to be stored and
 retrieved from the context, without having to reference the request
 explicitly.
When a request is handled in a controller, it is placed into its own domain.
 It is important that when using asynchronous operation, any callbacks passed into
 them are wrapped by the context, which will re-instantiate the current domain before
 running the callback.

controller (server).name: controller (server)
controller (server).description:
The Server Controller is the entry point for every app. Each server
 controller dwells at a top level URL (which is registered in routes.json).
 This module deals with loading server controllers and convenience functions
 exposed to them.

hooks (server).name: hooks (server)
hooks (server).description:
The hooks module is responsible for exposing events in the core that can be
overridden.

The main type are 'setup' and 'invocations'. setup is for middleware,
generally, and invocations happen for per request events, but the line
is blurry.

main (server).name: main (server)
main (server).description:
The Main file is responsible for organizing middleware and setting up
the core of the main app.

packager (server).name: packager (server)
packager (server).description:
The packager contains logic for compiling components and javascript
dependencies, as well as the endpoints for serving them as multiplexed XHR
Requests.

page (server).name: page (server)
page (server).description:
This module deals with how pages are generated, rendered and delivered to
the client. Each server controller is expected to use this API (or the res
object) to send a response to the client.

readfile (server).name: readfile (server)
readfile (server).description: This module provides a simple synchronous readfile + caching mechanism.

router (server).name: router (server)
router (server).description:
The router hooks up the routes on the server to the express app. It pull the
routes off the bootloader, as well as any controllers listed in routes.json
and creates their 'routes' and 'post_routes' handlers on behalf of the controller.

routes (server).name: routes (server)
routes (server).description:
The routes module is responsible for calling a route in a controller. It is
the entry point for all route handling on the server and is where the
context is created.

template (server).name: template (server)
template (server).description:
This module deals with how templates are rendered and the functions exposed
to the rendering context. In general, controllers will render templates, while Components
have their template rendering handled for them, so this class is mostly
called into from the Server Controller of the currently running app.

classitems.description:
This function returns a collection from the mongo DB, making sure that
the DB is created before using it.
classitems.name: get

params.name: db_name
params.description: A namespaced name for the DB

params.name: cb
params.description: Function to run when the DB is returned.

classitems.description: Returns the raw database connection
classitems.name: raw

classitems.description: Load a javascript module.  (works like require.js)
classitems.name: require

classitems.description: Inserts an asynchronous pagelet into the page
classitems.name: deliver

classitems.description: Bootload in a css file or array of css files
classitems.name: css

classitems.description: Bootload in a js file or array of js files
classitems.name: js

classitems.description: Bootload in a component or array of components
classitems.name: pkg

classitems.description:
After the http and socket servers are setup, the app and socket server are
passed to the install method, so the socket authorization can carry forward
context from the original request.
classitems.name: install

params.name: socket_server
params.description: (primus, socket.io, etc)

classitems.description: Invokes a function in a client JS module.
classitems.name: call

params.name: module_name
params.description:
the module name to load. This should be a full
path from the app root (app/client/some_module, f.e.)

params.name: function_name
params.description: function name to call. This should be exposed in the module.exports of the module being loaded.

params.name: args
params.description:
the arguments to pass the invoked function. Any
Components passed in will be properly marshalled to the client and
instantiated before calling this function.

classitems.description:
Injects raw JS into the page.
 Generally, this is used internally and not for external consumption.
classitems.name: raw

params.name: javascript_code
params.description: the javacsript code to insert into this page.

classitems.description:
Invokes a function on a controller. This is useful for passing state to
 the client controller during the initial page delivery.
classitems.name: controller

params.name: controller_name
params.description: the controller name (as just the module_name, not a complete path) to invoke the function on.

params.name: function_name
params.description: the function to call on the controller.

params.name: args
params.description:
any arguments to use when invoking the controller.
 Any Components used will be automatically marshalled before invoking this
 function on the client.

classitems.description:
Renders any queued up bridge invocations as a string to deliver to the client.
 This is used by core/server/page when generating the page
classitems.name: render

return.description: The raw HTML for the bridge invocations to be run on the client.

classitems.description: Adds a function for marshalling components across boundaries
Gets a marshaller by name, for testing purposes
Marshalls a serious of arguments

Creates a complete package for a component by reading package.json and
running the styles, js and templates through their preprocessors.
classitems.name: build_package

classitems.description:
Builds a Component for usage on the server. This Component is loaded from
the components/ directory out of the component's package.json file. When
instantiated on the server side, the component is created with only its main
JS file (the events file is only used on the client).

The component lifecycle for server created components is:

 Server:
 component.initialize(options)
 component.render
 component.server

 Client:
 component.initialize(options)
 component.client(options.client_options)
classitems.name: build

params.name: component_name
params.description: The name of the component ("button", f.e.)

params.name: options
params.description:
The options to pass to the component's initialize
function. The 'client_options' member of this Object is special and will be
passed to the client() function when this Component is instantiated on the
client.

params.name: cb
params.description: The callback to run once the Component is instantiated

classitems.description:
Renders this component into HTML for the server to send to the client. The
 side effect of this is that this component is also marshalled to the
 client through the bridge. 
 This function is safe to call multiple times and only one instance will be
 instantiated on the client.
classitems.name: toString

return.description: the generated HTML for this component

classitems.description:
Marshall this component through the bridge to the client.
 This function is safe to call multiple times and only one instance will be
 instantiated on the client.
classitems.name: marshall

return.description: the generated HTML for this component

classitems.description: Sets the current context in use
classitems.name: set

classitems.description: Sets the current context in use
classitems.name: get

classitems.description: Creates a new context (with prefilled globals) for a request to use.
classitems.name: create

params.name: defaults
params.description: The default options to pass into the domain

params.name: cb
params.description: the callback to run after this context is created

classitems.description:
Pulls the current domain out of the global namespace and makes sure that
 before 'func' is called, the domain is placed back into the global
 namespace. When running any async IO operations that potentially create
 domains, you should place the callback inside a wrap call. As a
 convenience, any function can have .wrap() or .intercept() called on it to
 do this automatically
classitems.name: wrap

classitems.description: Forces this route to check for HTTPS before serving it. This lets you make sure endpoints are secured.
classitems.name: require_https

params.name: A
params.description: route handler to wrap

classitems.description: Deserializes a URL param from jquery and returns it as a value.
classitems.name: value_of

classitems.description:
Calls a hook on the main module during a request

Every hook has a 'name', which lets app interact with the hook and after the
hook runs.
classitems.name: call

params.name: cb
